Dear Graydon:
Here are the minutes for the Board action on the
Chicago survey. These have been distributed to the
entire Board, plus Smythe, Probst, McCarty and Horton.
This should make it official — if it isnft already]
Griffith has already sent $1000 to Horton, plus
$2800 (the two-thirds suggested) to Hart and N0RC.
He asks that you, as acting president, send him written
authorization for these two advances. I think he would
like to receive this quite soon.
Holding meetings by telephone and telegraph is a
bit hectic — and may result in some of the same things
being done by two or more of us. But it did get done,
and I should say with a minimum of delay.
Good luck to you with that thesis outline J
Burton Paulu
